message.content:
It is difficult to provide an accurate summary of what most women in Monaco think of divorce, as individual opinions can vary significantly. However, like in many societies, attitudes towards divorce among women in Monaco may also differ based on factors such as personal experiences, cultural backgrounds, and societal norms. 

Some women in Monaco may view divorce as a viable option to end an unhappy or unhealthy marriage, supporting the idea of personal freedom and the right to pursue one's own happiness. They may see divorce as an opportunity for personal growth, independence, and the chance to build a better future.

On the other hand, some women in Monaco might hold more traditional views that prioritize the preservation of marriage and family stability. They may view divorce as a last resort or a failure, considering the impact it can have on children and societal perceptions. These individuals may place greater emphasis on maintaining the sanctity of marriage and working through challenges.

It is important to note that this summary is a reflection of general perspectives and does not represent the views of all women in Monaco, as opinions on divorce can greatly differ among individuals.
